Usage

Shaping with font created from an FT_Face (requires Hamza to be built with Freetype)

#include <hz.h>

int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
    FT_Error err;
    FT_Library lib;

    err = FT_Init_FreeType(&lib);

    if (err != FT_Err_Ok) { ... }

    FT_Face face;
    error = FT_New_Face(library, "Monospace.ttf", 0, &face);

    if (err != FT_Err_Ok) { ... }

    hz_font_t *font = hz_ft_font_create(face);
    hz_sequence_t *sequence = hz_sequence_create();

    const char *text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.";

    hz_sequence_load_utf8(sequence, text);
    hz_sequence_set_direction(sequence, HZ_DIRECTION_LTR);
    hz_sequence_set_script(sequence, HZ_SCRIPT_LATIN);
    hz_sequence_set_language(sequence, hz_lang("eng"));

    hz_shape(font, sequence, NULL, 0);

    hz_sequence_destroy(sequence);
    hz_font_destroy(font);

    FT_Done_Face(face);
    FT_Done_Freetype(lib);
    return 0;
}
hz_allocator_t
typedef struct
hz_allocator_t

Global heap allocator, an instance of this structure is stored internally and is used by the main memory pool. By default hz_allocator_t.mallocfn and hz_allocator_t.freefn are set to stdlib's malloc() and free().

If you want to set a custom internal allocator, use hz_set_custom_allocator as follows:

hz_allocator_t a;
a.mallocfn = (HZMALLOCFN)mymalloc;
a.freefn = (HZFREEFN)myfree;

hz_set_custom_allocator(a);
Variables
mallocfn
HZMALLOCFN mallocfn

Memory allocation function.

freefn
HZFREEFN freefn

Free allocated memory function.

hz_sequence_t
typedef struct
hz_sequence_t

A sequence of text, can be loaded with utf8 or unicode data.  Holds direction, script, language, as well as other data relevant for the shaping process.
